FW¶

FW module.

FW module provide functions to firewall service of Fujitsu K5 cloud REST API

k5lib.fw.create_firewall_policy(project_token, region, az, policy_name, policy_description, firewall_rules)¶

Creates firewall policy.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 token.
  • region – A valid K5 region.
  • az – A valid K5 az.
  • policy_name – (string) Name of the policy.
  • policy_description – (string) Description of the policy.
  • firewall_rules – (list) List of firewall rule ID:s
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.fw.create_firewall_rule(project_token, region, az, rule_name, rule_description, destination_ip, destination_port, protocol, source_ip, source_port, rule_action, enabled=True)¶

Create firewall rule.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A Valid K5 project token
  • region – A valid K5 region
  • az – A valid K5 availability zone
  • rule_name – (string) Name of the firewall rule
  • rule_description – (string) Description of the rule
  • destination_ip – (string) IP or CIDR of destination address.
  • destination_port – (string) Destination port number or a range. If range, port numbers are separated by colon. Specify a small port number first.
  • protocol – (string) The protocol that is matched by the firewall rule. Valid values are null, tcp, udp, and icmp. (Avoid the use of null when specifying the protocol for Neutron FWaaS rules. Instead, create multiple rules for both ‘tcp’ and ‘udp’ protocols independently.)
  • source_ip – (string) IP or CIDR of source address.
  • source_port – (string) Destination port number or a range. If range, port numbers are separated by colon. Specify a small port number first.
  • rule_action – (string) Action to be performed on the traffic matching the rule (allow, deny).
  • enabled – (bool) When set to False will disable this rule in the firewall policy. Facilitates selectively turning off rules without having to disassociate the rule from the firewall policy.
Returns:

JSON if succesful. Otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.fw.list_firewall_rules(project_token, region)¶

List firewall rules visible for the project.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – A valid K5 region
Returns:

JSON if succesfull, otherwise error from requests library.
